messages.message: @Chetan or maybe others, did we ever figure out what was wrong with travis+image tasks? I’ve noticed a bunch of bugs go through in PRs (even some mypy issues) that get caught by the Jenkins image-tasks tests. At first I thought maybe it was a problem with `make test-changes`, but now I see image-tasks is listed in `MODULES_TO_IGNORE`, which I assume comes from those issues a few weeks ago
Yeah I think we added those to unblock development despite the issues, we should really remove that now. imo, I think we should try to avoid using this fallback unless really necessary.

hm… i’ll be honest the specific things that were broken are fuzzy in my head now…. it might have been the issue @Heymian already found + fixed with unittest hanging when no tests existed in PY2 on linux.
i can take a quick look at it tomorrow. and at least document better what the problems are @Erick
removed it from the list, image-tasks looks like its passing in travis
you won’t know until you merge to master @Heymian unless you’re checking locally
since a change in that makefile doesn’t trigger `test-changes` to rebuild image-tasks.
i think it’ll be fine. think it was just that one issue with the empty folders
well it won’t be fine because of a legit mypy error right now, but should be good after the fix. :P
gif would be better if we couldn’t see where they landed.
